title: Relativistic Calogero-Sutherland Model: Spin Generalization, Quantum Affine Symmetry and Dynamical Correlation Functions
abstract: Spin generalization of the relativistic Calogero-Sutherland model is constructed by using the affine Hecke algebra and shown to possess the quantum affine symmetry $\uqglt$. The spin-less model is exactly diagonalized by means of the Macdonald symmetric polynomials. The dynamical density-density correlation function as well as one-particle Green function are evaluated exactly. We also investigate the finite-size scaling of the model and show that the low-energy behavior is described by the $C=1$ Gaussian theory. The results indicate that the excitations obey the fractional exclusion statistics and exhibit the Tomonaga-Luttinger liquid behavior as well.
